channel.title: Flashlight crashes game at first map (bm_c1a2a) of "Office Complex"
channel.description: Greetings Developers and Community, My first impression of Black Mesa: Unbelievable, not describable. Just wow... Sadly I encountered a rather heavy bug at the first map of "Office Complex" aka bm_c1a2a As soon as I want to turn on my flashlight, the game crashes back to desktop, saying "Half Life 2 does not work anymore". I tried several times to be certain and it definitely always happens the moment I press f. MDMP attached. Greetings KiLlEr [] hl2_4104_crash_2012_9_16T16_56_14C0.mdmp (95.4 KB)

item.title: Flashlight crashes game at first map (bm_c1a2a) of "Office Complex"
item.dc:creator: KiLlEr
item.description:
lexa2:

That’s ok, thanks for posting specs. Hardware you have should be more than OK for playing Black Mesa. Could still be a driver bug - ATI/AMD and notorious for the quality of their drivers. Had you double-checked that you’re using latest version of the driver (should be 12.8 or 12.9 as of now IIRC)? Had you tried switching the game into using non-HRD simplified lighting mode (i.e. shadows detail set to “Low” or “Middle”, HDR set to “None”, bloom effect - to “disabled”)?

Also, you could try resetting CCC settings into defaults (there been reports about the game crashing due to some settings combinations in CCC) or could try to downgrade your driver version to something more ancient.

driver is up to date, I will try the one with lower shadow details.
Btw I am already past the map, but it seems to happen at others too, but I forgot to write down at which ones.

Guys, please DO include your hardware and software configurations when posting bug reports. Most of the problems are specific to a restricted set of hardware or software so knowing the exact environment that causes misbehavior is extremely important.

Alright here ya go with my system (sorry that I forgot):
ASRock H77 Pro4-M Intel H77
Intel Core i5 2329 4x 3.00GHz
16GB (2x 8192MB ) G.Skill RipjawsX DDR3-1600
2048MB Gigabyte Radeon HD 7870 OC
OS is Windows 7 Professional 64bit

My system runs on a 128GB SSD, but Steam (and therefore Black Mesa) is installed on a usual (2TB ) Harddrive.
Since the computer is new (about 2 weeks) there shouldn’t be any driver issues.
